instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2610: What is 820-2610? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fireball capactiors and power issues
threads.message:
Hi.

This machine has no signs of liquid damage at all.
<CAPACITOR>C6612</CAPACITOR> was mostly ash and bare metal with a dark blast radius on the PCB.

Was no power, replaced <CAPACITOR>C6612</CAPACITOR> and it now powers but will power off abruptly most of the time.
Also <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> seems to warm a little, not hot just warm, when MagSafe is plugged in so I'll start looking around there.

Still powers abruptly powers off without charger plugged in.

Any likely causes or rails to start testing please?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fireball capactiors and power issues
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> issue. Does it shut down on AC power too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fireball capactiors and power issues
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 9850"]<CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> issue. Does it shut down on AC power too? [/QUOTE]

Yep surely does.
